text: The Garnavillo Township Bridge is a historic structure located west of Garnavillo, Iowa, United States. It spans an unnamed stream for . with Around the turn of the 20th-century Clayton County embarked on a project to replace its old bridges. On short crossing like this one they generally chose simple timber stringer structures. But for this one, and several others, they chose to take advantage of the large limestone deposits in the county. They contracted with stonemason A.C. Boyle of McGregor, Iowa to build this single deck arch bridge for $1,462.72. It replaced an old combination truss span. This bridge also been replaced, but it remains in place underneath the newer bridge. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1998. ==References== Category:Bridges completed in 1902 Category:Road bridges in Iowa Category:Bridges in Clayton County, Iowa Category:National Register of Historic Places in Clayton County, Iowa Category:Road bridges on the National Register of Historic Places in Iowa Category:Arch bridges in Iowa Category:Stone arch bridges in the United States
title: Garnavillo Township Bridge
